name: Building Progressive Web Apps
description: O'Reilly - A hands-on guide and reference for service workers, caching strategies, push notifications, and more. Everything you need to build a modern progressive web app.

name: Introduction to Service Worker
description: A gentle introduction to service workers.

name: Offline Web Applications Using IndexedDB & Service Worker
description: A great Udacity course introducing service workers and IndexedDB.

name: Service Workers Explained
description: Service workers explained by Alex Russell.

name: Building Offline Sites with ServiceWorkers and UpUp
description: A general introduction to service workers and using UpUp to provide offline functionality in minutes.

name: Service Workers 101
description: An infographic summarizing the most important parts of service workers API.

name: ServiceWorker Cookbook by Mozilla
description: A collection of recipes for different use cases.

name: The copy & paste guide to your first Service Worker
description: Shortest available introduction, by Remy Sharp.

name: The offline cookbook
description: The bible of service worker Patterns by Jake Archibald.

name: Designing Offline-First Web Apps
description: A fascinating look at design and UX considerations for dealing with various states of connectivity.

name: Background Sync Spec
description: The WIP spec for Background Sync.

name: Service Workers
description: W3C Specification - The official service workers spec.

name: Can I Use
description: Service Workers - Up-to-date browser support table of ServiceWorker API.

name: Jake Archibald
description: Is Service Worker ready? - Current status of ServiceWorker support in different browsers.

name: UpUp
description: A popular service worker library providing complete offline functionality for your site in 1 line of code.

name: sw-toolbox
description: A collection of simple helpers to simplify implementing common runtime caching patterns.

name: Manifest Generator
description: Generate a web app manifest, required for push notifications and installable web apps.

name: sw-precache
description: Generates a service worker to cache your local App Shell resources.

name: sw-offline-google-analytics
description: A service worker helper library to retry offline Google Analytics requests when a connection is available.

name: Workbox
description: a set of libraries and Node modules that make it easy to cache assets and take full advantage of features used to build progressive web apps.

name: Instant Loading: Building offline-first Progressive Web Apps
description: Google I/O 2016 - A quick dive into the most common technologies and techniques for building progressive web apps.

name: Offline Web Applications Using IndexedDB & Service Worker
description: This free Udacity course is a must if you're planning to dive deep into service workers.

name: Instant Loading with Service Workers (Chrome Dev Summit 2015)
description: Explains how to structure your web app to optimize load time for initial and return visitors, and cover helpful service worker libraries that minimize the amount of boilerplate code you'll have to write.

name: Service Workers in Production
description: A case-study about how Google I/O 2015 web app was built.

name: Measuring the Real-world Performance Impact of Service Workers
description: One of the most significant benefits of service workers (from a performance perspective, at least) is their ability to proactively control the caching of assets. A web application that can cache all of its necessary resources should load substantially faster for returning visitors. But what do these gains actually look like to real users? And how do you even measure this?
